intro: Bastardia macrophylla f. lanata, commonly known as the woolly bastardia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Aizoaceae. It is characterized by its thick, woolly foliage that covers the stems and leaves, providing a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, typically in clusters. It is native to southern Africa, where it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. This succulent is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established.
